intro: Astragalus pseudoxytropis, commonly known as the narrowleaf milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, pea-like flowers. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces pods that contain several seeds. It is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes, where it plays a role in soil stabilization and provides forage for wildlife.
